turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Cankilian Thoppu.
turn.2: Cankilian Thoppu Cankilian Thoppu facade or Poothathamby arch, simply known as Cankilian Thoppu (), is an ancient facade, and one of the remnants of the Jaffna kingdom.
turn.4: The arch is located on the Jaffna-Point Pedro Road, near Nallur, Jaffna.
turn.6: The Cankilian Thoppu is a archaeological protected monument in the Jaffna District and was listed as such by the Sri Lankan government in 2007.
turn.7: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.8: It is situated close to other physical remnants of the Jaffna kingdom and is believed to be part of the facade of the king's palace, even though its architecture style is typical of Dutch colonial architecture.
turn.9: Is it open to the public?
turn.10: The Cankilian Thoppu is located within the area known as the Pandiya Palace, which supports the connection with the Tamil kings and their kingdom.
